website_summaries.verdict: Extremely compact design gives you a bit more flexibility for working in tight spots than other models.
pros: Uses a brushless motor that will maximize battery longevity
Allows you to operate at three different speed settings, so you can match the speed to the particular job you're doing
Quite a bit smaller than other Makita impact drivers, so you'll be able to work in tight spaces more effectively
Delivers more torque than you'd expect, considering its size
cons: A little more expensive than some other impact driver models

customer_reviews.title: I like this wrench
customer_reviews.text: I like this wrench, but it's not powerful enough, it takes a long pull on the trigger to remove lug nuts torqued at 90lbs. Tool description says 210 ft lbs, which seems a good margin for lugs that are mostly at 90 to remove. I should have got the next size up at 720lf lbs. If I could return this, Id buy the bigger version, but alas I tossed the box out of excitement of finally owning a battery impact wrench!
customer_reviews.author: Mossback

customer_reviews.title: Appears To Be Used
customer_reviews.text: So, really torn with this one because I love Makita tools. However, I received this on in a box that was clear-taped up and seemed to be re-packaged. The impact wrench was loose in the box and the tool had rub marks on it that makes it look either used or beat up during delivery. It seems to work fine, but one would think that a "new" Makita tool would be packaged properly like a "new" tool. It wasn't advertised as a refurbished item, but that is the feeling I get when I look at this thing. I don't mind refurbished, but I like knowing that up front.
customer_reviews.author: nzpete

customer_reviews.title: This tool rocks.
customer_reviews.text: Superb performance. A must have for automotive work, especially if you don't have access to a pneumatic impact wrench. Just got it, and used it to change shocks and struts. A huge time saver for removing bolts. Multiple speeds and torque ranges make it perfect for not over-torquing when putting things back together.
customer_reviews.author: Ssinbad

customer_reviews.title: One of the best investments in the garage
customer_reviews.text: One of the best investments in the garage. Strong enough for car lug nuts, compact enough to use all over the vehicle. No more dragging air lines around for me.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Medium duty 1/2 drive impact...
customer_reviews.text: This is a medium duty impact driver tool. I really like it. Price wise is cheaper than the M12 and feels better on the hand. Tool and battery are a plus. The charger and the bag could be better ( not a fast charger and bag is small and cheaply designed) but not too bad either for $149 dollars. It has a bit more torque than the M12. It will keep that same torque until the battery drains out... About driving lag bolts on wood and anchors on concrete; it will do it's job but slowly. Again, " medium duty impact driver tool. Lastly, it is compact and not fatiguing on the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Another Good Tool from Makita.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those tools that once you have it you wonder how you did without it. I got it to change wheels and tires on cars. Works great on alloy wheels and breaks lug nuts free without issue on wheels in good condition. Tightens to about 60 ft pounds, so on wheels this means using your torque wrench for correct and final torque is a must. The Makita 18v system is great and the battery packs charge quickly. I
customer_reviews.author: Haans

customer_reviews.title: Short Anvil to Back
customer_reviews.text: This gun is short, which is great because it fits in tight places. It has just enough power to remove the lug nuts on my pickup truck which the lug nuts had been on for a while. It is no match for a half inch air gun power wise. It is much more handy than the air gun. I use this gun the most and like it.
customer_reviews.author: RSL1

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy customer
customer_reviews.text: It claims 210 ft. lbs. barely removed one lug nut on my c10 ( torqued at 80 ft lbs) . That’s why it’s being returned
customer_reviews.author: Ignacio P.

customer_reviews.title: Works, but WEAK
customer_reviews.text: Things it was too weak to break: 100ftlb lug nuts 130ftlb lug nuts 80ftlb suspension bolts it's also extremely loud. Its a sad day when a harbor frieght tool beats out something like makita.
customer_reviews.author: Aims

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I use this all day, every day, in my job in automotive aftertreatment R&D. I bolt together aftertreatment systems, among other things, and this has plenty of power. I do have a higher torque one that I use in very select circumstances, but easily 99% of what I do is handled by this. I don't use the variable torque application very often, if what I am working on requires precise torque I use a torque wrench. If you are using the Makita 18v system, this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: HandyDan

customer_reviews.title: Small and powerful
customer_reviews.text: End up using this frequently, where I might have used a hammer drill Got this specifically to change lug nuts and the fact the battery can still work after a year sitting. Its proven great all around on many tight engine situations. Consistent torque near 100 ft/lbs Instant power and great ergonomic weight distribution, while being light. Might be better with two more LEDs and probably two at the end of the handle for more coverage. I almost always use it in situations where it is dark, even during the day.
customer_reviews.author: uaflyer

customer_reviews.title: POWERFUL ...Do it all Impact.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful... Not much bigger than the xdt13. If you are just getting an impact for vehicle use, get this instead of the smaller one. This can do it all. Has 3 mode control so you dont strip a bolt. Just use a 1/2 to 3/8 adapter. If your using hex bits(philips head and hex drill bits) just get a 1/2 to 1/4 hex adapter... Also another option is the Milwaukee 12V stubby impact.
customer_reviews.author: blz

customer_reviews.title: No Power/Weak
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it could at least remove lug nuts torqued to 85 lbs. It wouldn't even break them loose, and its rated twice as high as that. Strong pass on this. I still highly recommend Makita tools, just go with the bigger model.
customer_reviews.author: Rick's_Life

customer_reviews.title: Great Impact
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my 4Runner to add a 2.75 inch lift. Worked awesome but only gripe I had was the direction switch next to the trigger was sensitive. All my other Mikita tools have a more positive feel. There was a few times I handled it and the switch went all the way across to opposite setting when I did not want it too. The seller was great to work with as they said to send it back in for refund. I want to buy again from the same seller but there price went up $9. So I wait until the same buyers price goes back down.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Garcia

customer_reviews.title: If the forward/reverse switch wasn't too easy to flip by accident, this would be a 5
customer_reviews.text: I got this thng for shade-tree emchanic activities. The day after it came I removed and reinstalled a set of wheels and also removed the rear bumper and bumper support brackets on a 1997 Tacoma, installed a Tow Bar/Hitch, and reinstalled the bumper and brackets. The thing was strong enough to break free bolts that hadn't moved in 23 years, and strong enough to snug them back up. Battery still has charge. My only beef is that it's to easy to bump the forward/reverse swithc while you're trying to maneubver the thing into cramped spaces from weird anges, which is what I was doing with the bumper in my driveway. Redesign that switch and the thing is golden.
customer_reviews.author: Thaddeus

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, bad detent design.
customer_reviews.text: Tool is powerfull and compact. Its amazing sans one bad desighn flaw. The detent that retains sockets. Dosent retain all that well and at the same time sockets can be tought to remove. Love the tool besides the detent gripe.
customer_reviews.author: Hmw96

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Wonderfully compact. 210ft/lbs of torque and basically the same size as the 3/8 driver makes this very useful. Reverse auto stop setting works great I just pull the trigger again and it stops itself again as soon as it takes the nut off making it very hassle free. Drains my 3AH battery pretty quickly but it works on the small 1.5AH battery I have as well that won't work with any of the larger makita tools. so I may have to get a pair of 5AH batteries to keep up with this thing eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of Power in a Compact Size
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this impact gun to tackle a front end suspension job. It does not disappoint. It took off the tires without breaking a sweat on the highest setting. Next up it took apart bolts and nuts that had been sitting dormant since 2009. I used it to put on the same components but at the lowest power setting of the three available. Then I hand torqued everything. All in all, if you plan on doing any kind of work on your car this is a must have. Saved me plenty of time and sore muscles. The size and weight are perfect. Don’t be deceived with its small size! It’s a mighty little helper!
customer_reviews.author: Julio Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Get the bundle!
customer_reviews.text: I've been eyeing this torque wrench for a long time and finally jumped on this bundle, which is much more affordable than buying tools only or tools plus battery. For about the same price of a tool, you get the tool, a 2AH battery, a charger, and a small tool bag. I sold the charger locally already so it further cuts down my cost. Can't wait to use it to rotate my tires Friday!
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Small and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This little baby is great for automotive work. It’s small and lightweight but still powerful enough to remove rusty suspension bolts. The only thing it hasn’t been able to remove is the crank pulley on my Honda, which requires more than 200 ftlb to remove so it’s to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Durability is a one batteries last a good amount of time I have the 5.0 mah pacs
customer_reviews.text: I like the compact size of this it has a nice amount of power but I don’t know if it has The full 210 ft lbs tht they claimed I had a few Lugnuts at the junkyard that it wouldn’t take off A couple of suspension boats it wouldn’t break I had no problem with axle nuts but subframe bolts was a no go
customer_reviews.author: Fee

customer_reviews.title: As expected.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from a Amazon reseller in late November due to the high price HD had on it for the tool only. Unfortunately, as I assumed would happen, HD ran this as a X-mas kit buy and for $5 more, the tool came with a charger, 2AH battery and a bag. I wish I would have waited two weeks, but the tool does what was expected.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: It could use a little more torque, but I like it just the same.
customer_reviews.text: I think it could use a little more losening torque. It can take off most of the lug nuts at work, but it struggles if the last guy over torqued the nuts. My little pneumatic Nitrocat 1375-xl had to take over on at least one occasion. I like it for convenience, but this tool has room for improvement. I don't want to get the giant high torque XWT08.
customer_reviews.author: N. D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the home garage and beats listening to a noisy compressor. It's more compact then I expected, build quality is spot on. I tested this on some trailer wheels and my 3/4 truck, it broke the lug nuts loose no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Denny

customer_reviews.title: Buy it you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a machine is all I can say! Buy it you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: self fix it man

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Worked on my dad's truck wheels but not my car... The car was torqued to 90 ftlb per the manual. Must have siezed to over the 210 rated torque of the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. I have arthritis in both my hands so it hurts to turn a wrench or ratchet anymore so this makes work so much easier on my body, its light weight and it has the power to do most of what you will need to do. I would highly recommend this tool to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job!
customer_reviews.text: Having bought this recently, I've used it for brake and suspension jobs. It doesn't feel as big, bulky or heavy, even with an 18V battery attached to it. The unit is also pretty powerful for its size, and is extremely well constructed. The country of origin on this unit is China, but don't let that throw you off. Makita has had its own manufacturing facilities in China since 1993, with a second facility set up in 2000.
customer_reviews.author: Balkan

customer_reviews.title: great torque
customer_reviews.text: Its a Makita, why say more. Best at what it is meant to do. Anyone can use this tool, add a battery & a 1/2" drive socket. Just the best tool for the job, much easier to maneuver than a air impact.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great Impact Wrench at a Awesome Price Point
customer_reviews.text: Makita is a quality tool company. The XWT11 is a good lower end torque impact wrench (210 ft pounds) that is good for many things that does not require mid torque levels. The new XWT17 will not be out until after summer of 2020 and the price for this impact is a good value ($149 for the kit) Absolutely great for most jobs and to have handy in your trunk when needed. I placed this Impact in a single hard case with Kaizen foam and fits great in these.
customer_reviews.author: James Hall

customer_reviews.title: Can undo lug nuts
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. Tons of torque. Be very careful not to destroy the piece you are working on. Too much torque for anything less than lug nuts. Would be a great tool to carry in car for long trips.
customer_reviews.author: emeron

customer_reviews.title: beats using a wrench or air tools
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, Makita quality, can share batteries with my other Makita stuff. The auto-stop feature when the nut comes loose is a great idea, no more chasing lug nuts all over the driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: Love how small and light this impact is especially with the smaller batteries. Kinda wish it had more torque still had to use the breaker bar on some bolts but for most stuff works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this impact wrench to take the lug nuts and suspension components on/off my crossover SUV. This lightweight tool works great for that! I used the 2 amp-hour battery for a few hours and it still had a full charge at the end of the job. Note that this is a low-torque tool - if you need "heavy duty" for heavy trucks or other work, this may be too small. For consumer-grade DIY automotive maintenance, this works great.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Finfrock

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Perfect for automotive work as it's smaller and lighter than the big brother XWT08Z. After using mine, my father fell in love with it and bought his own. If you're already invested in the Makita line, it's a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Makita quality 👍
customer_reviews.text: I just got this earlier this week so I haven't really had time to try it out maxed out. I have removed some stuff for my wife's Jeep with it and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: OpiemusRex

customer_reviews.title: great little impact
customer_reviews.text: This powerful impact is able to take off 150 ft lbs lugs on a pickup truck - no problem! Amazing for it size. Nice kit to put in your truck for emergencies or use to work on your vehicle. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Betta5

customer_reviews.title: Awesome compact impact
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Been using air tools since the 1980s and this is my first using battery powered impacts. It removed wheel lugs and axle nut torqued to 217 ft-lbf with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Keiko

customer_reviews.title: Big power
customer_reviews.text: This impact is awesome. I finally got tired of using my bit driver as an impact and upgraded to this thing. It has plenty of power and is light weight. Should have bought it sooner
customer_reviews.author: Aisha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Awweeeesome.... how could I have lived without this. Small, fairly powerful and light.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Batteries do take a bit to charge. 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I use it every day and it works amazing never had any problems, I take apart and put back together EL Jay screens for a mining company so its outside in the freezing temperatures and works perfectly every time.
customer_reviews.author: Michal

customer_reviews.title: makita the best
customer_reviews.text: Ive been a loyal makita customer for a while now. Ive yet to see a tool from makita that doesnt do what its supposed to do. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: El Chuyito

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite tool.
customer_reviews.text: Battery life, quality, convenience, and strength of this means that I use this far more than my air impact or air ratchet.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Groves

customer_reviews.title: Compact, powerful
customer_reviews.text: Makita quality is way above that of ryobi. You can feel the quality when you hold them side by side. Makita items are more precise
customer_reviews.author: margaret

customer_reviews.title: Good tool. Trigger broke off during delivery.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived and plastic trigger piece was broken off. Easy fix, just superglued it back in place. Otherwise an excellent working product that has saved me time.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Swedlund

customer_reviews.title: Great powerful tool in a compact design
customer_reviews.text: Used for my car and motorcycle. A must have for a DIY’er in your tool box and it’s a Makita so you’re in good hands
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: So impressed with this Makita 1/2" Sq. Impact Wrench. Plenty of torque, made the job effortless. Used this tool while replacing all four strut/spring assemblies, all four rotors and all break pads. And of course removing all the lights was so easy, no breaker bar needed!
customer_reviews.author: Greg B

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to a makita tool bag
customer_reviews.text: Was much smaller than the dewalt we were borrowing. And still had the same ratings. I guess it comes down to what batteries you already have. This was a no brained for me as we have 8-10 18v 5a batteries on our truck We have the 36vpole pruner /weed eater , 36vchainsaw, impact, 18vdrill, sawsall and 36v blower
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My impact sockets don't lock in no biggie
customer_reviews.text: I've only used 3s so far, lasted half a day but it's pulling some heavyweight with all that rust. I'm sure my 5s would do better no problem. I've walked around the job site with this one thinking it's my regular impact so it's light. With the time it's saved me it's paid for it's self hopefully it lasts or nobody likes it more than I do
customer_reviews.author: N8ev$killz

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: I use it as i am a fire sprinkler tech . great for tightening vicks and riser hardware . various speeds work great and has power. Ive also used to take off car wheels when ive gotten a flat tire.
customer_reviews.author: Rony Juarez

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for auto works
customer_reviews.text: I used it to remove the wheels on my BMW and it works great, takes a little longer than my coded tool but still do the job
customer_reviews.author: Neilrmp

customer_reviews.title: not enough power
customer_reviews.text: I bought for auto repair and used for taking wheels nuts out. It was not able to turn the nuts. I had to do manually, and used an extension bar. I had to wait for my parts, so the return time window was passed.
customer_reviews.author: Rangers

customer_reviews.title: GHreat product
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, very strong, I have used this brand for years and have had outstanding results with them.
customer_reviews.author: GR Culpepper

customer_reviews.title: I was totally surprised
customer_reviews.text: This impact gun surprised me for the size. This thing has some power. I'm not sure if it more powerful than a air Impact gun but it is strong
customer_reviews.author: JanF7

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: It's what I expected from the product and as described with all features functioning well.
customer_reviews.author: Regi Robles

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Makita really impressed me with the interchangeable batteries. This impact gun is not super strong with the 3.0 batteries but I really wouldn't expect it to be, I bought it to fit into tight spaces and it does that, if you want something with more power but something bigger or buy bigger batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have. Decent torque. No hose to pull around and not much difference in size to a pneumatic. Mikita quality.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen T.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.text: I didnt know what I was missing. Plenty of Ft lbs torg perfect for automobile work.
customer_reviews.author: SDM

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This is one badass impact gun. No need for air wrenches with this gun
customer_reviews.author: Jim B

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these impacts for my job and needed something lighter and smaller than a standard size. They performed well the first time out and I worked them. Only problem is for industrial use like I use them you need larger amp hour battery.
customer_reviews.author: toby

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool. Just like all the other tools in this line.
customer_reviews.author: Hop

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Have used quite a bit since receiving and it’s awesome
customer_reviews.author: Jk

customer_reviews.title: Heavy hitter
customer_reviews.text: Powerful little impact wrench that’s powerful enough for even pick up truck lug nuts. Typical makita quality and packs a punch.
customer_reviews.author: Barri Cornwall

customer_reviews.title: Power!!
customer_reviews.text: The compact powerhouse is awesome!! Makes quick work of keeping all my ATVs tight and right. Its not a HEAVY duty insane torque monster like the 10lb units you see. Its Compact plenty of power tool. Every tool has a job this one is Perfect for the size and weight.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Roy

customer_reviews.title: Nice sized torque wrench!
customer_reviews.text: Have used it a few times on lug nuts and replacing suspension and shocks pretty effortlessly. Slowly building up my makita tool collections!
customer_reviews.author: bacon

customer_reviews.title: Weak!
customer_reviews.text: Nowhere near strong enough to break lug nuts loose. Much weaker than advertised
customer_reviews.author: TMM

customer_reviews.title: A lot of power for a small tool.
customer_reviews.text: It took out my dodge truck lug nuts with no problem. Impressive.
customer_reviews.author: 442 Ojisan

customer_reviews.title: This thing is torqy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to work on cars and I can definitely say that I did not need a more powerful gun, not yet at least. Love the speed settings and the torque it has. Great buy, if you need it.. and if you are in makita lineup of course
customer_reviews.author: Nicolai

customer_reviews.title: The beast!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool.... Light weight with plenty of power for the most stubborn situations. A real favorite when production is at hand.
customer_reviews.author: P. Direct

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like
customer_reviews.text: No battery lasts as long as you want it to but this is an excellent product. Light, powerful, and well valued.
customer_reviews.author: Devon from AZ

customer_reviews.title: Compact and strong
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I got it, I used it to loosen up lug nuts on my truck torqued to 140 ft/lbs and took them off with ease... Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Ramos

customer_reviews.title: I like the product
customer_reviews.text: I dint think that it would do what I purchased for but I was surprised that I work And I got deliver so quickly too
customer_reviews.author: miguel monterroso

customer_reviews.title: Very good no problem yet
customer_reviews.text: I can take off any rusted on bolt or lug nut I could find in my shop and it did it just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Strong to remove nuts off the tire on a 3500 van.
customer_reviews.text: Took the nuts of my jeep liberty. Then tried it on a Chevy 3500 van, worked very good no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: This is one awesome little tool
customer_reviews.text: I use it in my garage when I am rotating tires on my vehicles. This tool has plenty of torque for this task. Nice compact tool!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Werner

customer_reviews.title: Gotta love Makita!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is great tool. Strong! Makita quality!
customer_reviews.author: Rick G.

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: Has great power and will surprise you when you use it. Very happy with this item
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Williams

customer_reviews.title: Right tool for the job
customer_reviews.text: I own both this and the larger impact from makita. For lugnuts this is a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.text: Very good tool for the money. Used it for over 6 month constantly. I even use it sometimes to drill my holes on powerline poles, when my 7/16 impact loses charge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: powerful tool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for the lug nuts, it works well on a small car, powerful and easy to use !
customer_reviews.author: zipingzheng

customer_reviews.title: 😃
customer_reviews.text: This thing will get down for sure. High torque in a small package.
customer_reviews.author: Nope

customer_reviews.title: Powerful for its size.
customer_reviews.text: I like its compact size, yet it develops the power I need for the purpose I’m using it for. Uses the same battery as several of my other Makita cordless power tools.
customer_reviews.author: Roger J. Albert

customer_reviews.title: Great Impact Wrench.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what i was missing working on my car and house stuff. Compliment the impact drill that i have.
customer_reviews.author: giliep

customer_reviews.title: High torque
customer_reviews.text: Got it on September 26 put it right to work on removing old control arms and works pretty good - Update in a month
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier. More than enough torque to handle tractor nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Tim O.

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Makita course it’s good
customer_reviews.text: For its size and weight, does everything I need it to do! Just another item to my Makita collection !
customer_reviews.author: david r. grove

customer_reviews.title: Love it wish I had purchased sooner
customer_reviews.text: Much lighter and smaller than the full size Makita impact
customer_reviews.author: signman71

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is not heavy and very good it will do most of my work in the automachenic shop
customer_reviews.author: Ismail

customer_reviews.title: Great service and on time
customer_reviews.text: I got it in a few days and can’t wait to use it I fill like taking my tires off of my car just to try it out lol and real good and fast service
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Brushless
customer_reviews.text: Works great just enough power to loosen the lug nuts. Light weight very versatile. Would recommend to all mechanics or do it yourselfers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this gun!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you work on your own vehicles or have a lot of projects I would highly recommend having this guy in your tool box.
customer_reviews.author: kristen mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool
customer_reviews.text: Very good tool, opens lugs easily. Done every thing I needed it for without problems
customer_reviews.author: ran

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have always got good use out of my Makitas and so far this is no exception
customer_reviews.author: Kid Harris

customer_reviews.title: very good prduct of makita
customer_reviews.text: its worked very fine on my Subaru forester . its open all 4 tires nuts with no difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: amazon shoper

customer_reviews.title: Product with no flaws
customer_reviews.text: Just want to say I haven’t stopped using this product, comes in handy for quick fix jobs
customer_reviews.author: Besy

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: All good so far! I’ve only used it once and I really like it
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Great Makita tools
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool just what I expected. Sockets are easy to change.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: I like bosch for saws (table saw
customer_reviews.text: I like bosch for saws (table saw, and miter). I like milwaukee for recip saws. Other than that, I buy everything else from Makita. They are the best. And out of their entire lineup, my favorite has got to be their impacts. (Although, the double battery blower is pretty nuts)
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great to have in a emergency or a simple job.
customer_reviews.author: Johan Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Impact with great power!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always loved Makita tools and this was no exception! Love the power!
customer_reviews.author: John Sugalski aka “BUBBA”

product_meta.title: Makita XWT11Z 18V LXT Lithium-Ion Brushless Cordless 3-Speed 1/2" Sq. Drive Impact Wrench, Tool Only
product_meta.description: Style:Bare ToolThe Makita 18V LXT Lithium-Ion Brushless 3-speed ½” impact wrench (XWT11Z, Tool only) combines extended run time and speed control for unmatched fastening performance. The XWT11Z is powered by a Makita Brushless motor for longer run time, increased power and speed, and longer tool life. Three speeds with reverse rotation auto-stop mode stops rotation in two seconds when fastener is adequately loosened, making the XWT11Z ideal for automotive, installation, and fabrication trades.
feature_bullets: BL Brushless motor delivers 210 feet pounds Of max torque
Compact and ergonomic design at only 5 to 3/4 inches Long
3 Speed power selection switch (0 to 1, 600/ 0 2, 100/ 0 2, 800 RPM & 0 1, 800/ 0 2, 600/ 0 3, 500 IPM) for precise fastening control in a wide range of applications
Reverse rotation auto stop mode stops rotation and impact in two seconds when fastener is loosened adequately
Efficient BL Brushless motor is electronically controlled to optimize battery energy use for up to 50 percent longer run time per charge

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars404 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
